document.discussion_title: Numis Securities Ltd Trims Helical Bar plc (HLCL) Target Price to GBX 481
document.topic_text: Tweet Helical Bar plc (LON:HLCL) had its price target reduced by Numis Securities Ltd from GBX 550 ($7.08) to GBX 481 ($6.19) in a report issued on Tuesday. Numis Securities Ltd currently has a buy rating on the stock. A number of other research analysts also recently issued reports on HLCL. JPMorgan Chase & Co. restated an overweight rating and set a GBX 540 ($6.95) target price on shares of Helical Bar plc in a research report on Thursday, May 12th. Peel Hunt reiterated an add rating and issued a GBX 450 ($5.79) price objective on shares of Helical Bar plc in a research report on Tuesday, May 24th. Two research analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating and three have issued a buy rating to the company. The stock has an average rating of Buy and a consensus price target of GBX 483.40 ($6.22). In related news, insider Slade,Michael purchased 42,392 shares of Helical Bar plc stock in a transaction that occurred on Monday, July 25th. The stock was purchased at an average price of GBX 273 ($3.52) per share, for a total transaction of £115,730.16 ($149,021.58). Also, insider Cotton ,Richard purchased 10,000 shares of Helical Bar plc stock in a transaction that occurred on Wednesday, May 25th. The shares were bought at an average price of GBX 399 ($5.14) per share, with a total value of £39,900 ($51,377.80). Helical Bar plc ( LON:HLCL ) opened at 279.75 on Tuesday. The stock’s market cap is GBX 319.70 million. Helical Bar plc has a 52-week low of GBX 228.00 and a 52-week high of GBX 475.50. The company has a 50-day moving average price of GBX 268.38 and a 200 day moving average price of GBX 350.89. The business also recently declared a dividend, which was paid on Friday, July 29th. Investors of record on Thursday, June 30th were given a dividend of GBX 0.72 ($0.01) per share. The ex-dividend date was Thursday, June 30th. This represents a dividend yield of 0.18%. Helical Bar plc is a property investment and development company, which operates across various sectors of the property industry. The Company’s segments include Investment properties and Developments. Investment properties are owned or leased by the Company for long-term income and for capital appreciation, and Trading properties, which are owned or leased with the intention to sell. Helical Bar plc Helical Bar plc
